intro: Varasia clarkei, commonly known as the Clarke's varasia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
